title: Cert III in Telecommunications Technology
description: The Certificate III in Telecommunications Technology is designed for telecommunications technology operators involved in installation, fault-finding, and testing of telecommunications systems and equipment.
qualificationDescription: Prepares individuals to assess installation needs, perform installations, and troubleshoot networks across various telecommunications environments.

coreUnits.title: Use hand and power tools
Use electrical skills when working with telecommunications networks
Determine and apply technologies within a telecommunications system
Locate, identify and rectify telecommunications network faults
Follow work health and safety and environmental policy and procedures
Provide customer service to telecommunications customers

electiveUnits.title: Install, maintain and modify customer premises communications cabling: ACMA Open Rule
Install, test and terminate optical fibre cable on customer premises
Install, terminate and certify structured cabling installation
Install aerial cable for communications applications

learningOutcomes: Install and maintain telecommunications cabling.
Troubleshoot and resolve network faults.
Ensure workplace and environmental safety.
Provide customer service and technical support.
deliveryMode: Hands-on training at the workplace or training facility.

skillTree.description: Essential training for working safely and effectively with customer premises cabling installations.

outcomes.title: Install, maintain and modify customer premises communications cabling: ACMA Restricted Rule

title: Open Cabler Registration
description: Essential training for working safely and effectively with customer premises cabling installations. Covering both ACMA Restricted and Open Rules, this course equips learners with practical skills and technical knowledge needed to comply with industry standards.
qualificationDescription: Focuses on compliant and secure installation techniques for customer premises cabling.

coreUnits.title: Follow work health and safety and environmental policy and procedures
Install, maintain and modify customer premises communications cabling: ACMA Restricted Rule
Install, maintain and modify customer premises communications cabling: ACMA Open Rule

learningOutcomes: Terminate and connect cables across sockets within customer premises
Understand and apply the ACMA cabling licence requirements
Interpret and adhere to ACMA mandatory technical standards
Install backbone cabling and facility cabling to ensure connectivity throughout premises
Maintain, modify, and accurately update cabling records
Conduct pre-handover testing of Telephone Cabling Systems to verify installation quality
deliveryMode: Hands-on training conducted at the student’s workplace or training facility.

title: Optical Fibre Cabling
description: Immersive, practical training in optical fibre installation, testing, and maintenance for nbn™ Skill 33 & 9.
qualificationDescription: Equips learners to work confidently in optical telecommunications environments.

coreUnits.title: Install, test and terminate optical fibre cable on customer premises
Inspect, clean and handle optical fibre cable and connectors

learningOutcomes: Understanding optical fibre cable types
Key factors affecting light propagation
Assessing and optimizing optical fibre performance
Mastery of installation techniques
Ensuring safety and proper handling practices
Professional fibre termination skills
deliveryMode: Hands-on, immersive training with industry-grade tools.

title: Pit & Pipe Installation (ACMA Underground Endorsement)
description: Hands-on training in underground cable installation and infrastructure construction for telecommunications.
qualificationDescription: Prepares students for safe and effective installation of underground telecommunications infrastructure.

coreUnits.title: Install underground cable for communications applications
Construct underground telecommunications infrastructure
Install underground enclosures and conduit

learningOutcomes: Safe worksite setup and management
Working around other underground assets
Installation techniques for pits and conduits
Pit remediation practices for durability and compliance
In-field exercises to reinforce practical skills
deliveryMode: Hands-on training conducted at the training facility.

title: Fibre to the Curb – FTTC Technician
description: Practical training in FTTC installations, troubleshooting, and maintenance, providing technicians with the expertise to ensure network reliability.
qualificationDescription: Covers essential FTTC network skills with hands-on techniques and diagnostic tools.

coreUnits.title: Joint metallic conductor cable in access network
Work on and resolve recurrent network faults
Jumper metallic conductor cable in the access network

learningOutcomes: Safe work practices for the FTTC environment
Cable recognition, color coding, and appropriate usage
Systematic fault-finding techniques for network quality
Testing techniques and network performance analysis
deliveryMode: Hands-on training conducted at the training facility.

title: Optical Fibre Jointing and Splicing
description: Hands-on training in splicing and terminating optical fibre cables for telecommunications projects, aligning with nbn™ Skill 13 standards.
qualificationDescription: Focuses on fibre jointing and splicing techniques required for field-ready applications.

coreUnits.title: Splice and terminate optical fibre cable for telecommunications projects

learningOutcomes: Understanding optical fibre properties and transmission
Fibre preparation and splicing techniques
Installation and use of fibre closures and distribution frames
Conducting transmission testing to ensure quality
deliveryMode: Hands-on training with specialized tools and equipment.

title: Structured Cabling
description: Intensive, hands-on training in the installation, termination, and certification of structured cabling systems.
qualificationDescription: Prepares learners to work confidently in telecommunications environments.

coreUnits.title: Install, terminate and certify structured cabling installation

learningOutcomes: Understanding structured cabling standards for voice and data integration
Planning and utilizing pathways and spaces for cabling
Hands-on installation and termination techniques
Field testing of cabling for compliance and performance
deliveryMode: Hands-on training conducted at the training facility.

title: Coaxial Cabling
description: Practical, hands-on training in installing and terminating coaxial cables within customer premises.
qualificationDescription: Equips learners with foundational skills for effective coaxial cable installation and termination.

coreUnits.title: Install and terminate coaxial cabling

learningOutcomes: Understanding connectors and their applications in coaxial systems
Techniques for proper coaxial cable installation
Overview of coaxial cable systems and their various uses
Conducting transmission testing to ensure performance
deliveryMode: Hands-on training conducted at the training facility.

title: Aerial Cabling (ACMA Aerial Endorsement)
description: Immersive, practical training for installing and supporting aerial communication cables.
qualificationDescription: Provides essential skills for aerial cable support construction and installation.

coreUnits.title: Install aerial cable for communications applications
Construct aerial cable supports

learningOutcomes: Preparing sites for aerial cable support construction
Installing support structures with pole and wall support
Planning and executing aerial cable installations
Ensuring secure sealing and stability of aerial cables
deliveryMode: Hands-on training conducted at the training facility.

title: Optical Fibre Hygiene
description: Hands-on training in the essential practices of inspecting, cleaning, and handling optical fibre cables and connectors.
qualificationDescription: Prepares students to uphold the highest standards of fibre hygiene and safety.

coreUnits.title: Inspect, clean and handle optical fibre cable and connectors

learningOutcomes: Understanding fibre basics, including core safety practices and handling
Identifying cable and connector types for proper handling
Techniques for inspecting and cleaning fibre connectors
deliveryMode: Hands-on training conducted with industry-approved tools.
